verses.text: Keep silence before me, O islands ; and let the people renew \add their\add* strength : let them come near ; then let them speak : let us come near together to judgment.

Who raised up the righteous \add man\add* from the east , called him to his foot , gave the nations before him, and made \add him\add* rule over kings ? he gave \add them\add* as the dust to his sword , \add and\add* as driven stubble to his bow.\f + \fr 41.2 \ft the righteous…: Heb. righteousness\f*
He pursued them, \add and\add* passed safely ; \add even\add* by the way \add that\add* he had not gone with his feet.\f + \fr 41.3 \ft safely: Heb. in peace\f*
Who hath wrought and done \add it\add*, calling the generations from the beginning ? I the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the first , and with the last ; I \add am\add* he.
The isles saw \add it\add*, and feared ; the ends of the earth were afraid , drew near , and came.
They helped every one his neighbour ; and \add every one\add* said to his brother , Be of good courage.\f + \fr 41.6 \ft Be…: Heb. Be strong\f*

So the carpenter encouraged the goldsmith , \add and\add* he that smootheth \add with\add* the hammer him that smote the anvil , saying , It \add is\add* ready for the sodering : and he fastened it with nails , \add that\add* it should not be moved.\f + \fr 41.7 \ft goldsmith: or, founder\f*\f + \fr 41.7 \ft him…: or, the smiting\f*\f + \fr 41.7 \ft saying…: or, saying of the soder, It is good\f*
But thou, Israel , \add art\add* my servant , Jacob whom I have chosen , the seed of Abraham my friend.

\add Thou\add* whom I have taken from the ends of the earth , and called thee from the chief men thereof, and said unto thee, Thou \add art\add* my servant ; I have chosen thee, and not cast thee away. \p

¶ Fear thou not; for I \add am\add* with thee: be not dismayed ; for I \add am\add* thy God : I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.

Behold, all they that were incensed against thee shall be ashamed and confounded : they shall be as nothing; and they that strive with thee shall perish.\f + \fr 41.11 \ft they that strive…: Heb. the men of thy strife\f*

Thou shalt seek them, and shalt not find them, \add even\add* them that contended with thee: they that war against thee shall be as nothing, and as a thing of nought.\f + \fr 41.12 \ft them that…: Heb. the men of thy contention\f*\f + \fr 41.12 \ft they…: Heb. the men of thy war\f*
For I the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God will hold thy right hand , saying unto thee, Fear not; I will help thee.

Fear not, thou worm Jacob , \add and\add* ye men of Israel ; I will help thee, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and thy redeemer , the Holy One of Israel.\f + \fr 41.14 \ft men: or, few men\f*

Behold, I will make thee a new sharp threshing instrument having teeth : thou shalt thresh the mountains , and beat \add them\add* small , and shalt make the hills as chaff.\f + \fr 41.15 \ft teeth: Heb. mouths\f*

Thou shalt fan them, and the wind shall carry them away , and the whirlwind shall scatter them: and thou shalt rejoice in the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add and\add* shalt glory in the Holy One of Israel.

\add When\add* the poor and needy seek water , and \add there is\add* none, \add and\add* their tongue faileth for thirst , I the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will hear them, I the God of Israel will not forsake them.
I will open rivers in high places , and fountains in the midst of the valleys : I will make the wilderness a pool of water , and the dry land springs of water.
I will plant in the wilderness the cedar , the shittah tree , and the myrtle , and the oil tree ; I will set in the desert the fir tree , \add and\add* the pine , and the box tree together :
That they may see , and know , and consider , and understand together , that the hand of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath done this, and the Holy One of Israel hath created it. \p
Produce your cause , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; bring forth your strong \add reasons\add*, saith the King of Jacob.\f + \fr 41.21 \ft Produce: Heb. Cause to come near\f*

Let them bring \add them\add* forth , and shew us what shall happen : let them shew the former things , what they \add be\add*, that we may consider them, and know the latter end of them; or declare us things for to come.\f + \fr 41.22 \ft consider…: Heb. set our heart upon them\f*
Shew the things that are to come hereafter , that we may know that ye \add are\add* gods : yea, do good , or do evil , that we may be dismayed , and behold \add it\add* together.

Behold, ye \add are\add* of nothing , and your work of nought : an abomination \add is he that\add* chooseth you.\f + \fr 41.24 \ft of nothing: or, worse than nothing\f*\f + \fr 41.24 \ft of nought: or, worse than of a viper\f*

I have raised up \add one\add* from the north , and he shall come : from the rising of the sun shall he call upon my name : and he shall come upon princes as \add upon\add* morter , and as the potter treadeth clay.

Who hath declared from the beginning , that we may know ? and beforetime , that we may say , \add He is\add* righteous ? yea, \add there is\add* none that sheweth , yea, \add there is\add* none that declareth , yea, \add there is\add* none that heareth your words.
The first \add shall say\add* to Zion , Behold , behold them: and I will give to Jerusalem one that bringeth good tidings.
For I beheld , and \add there was\add* no man ; even among them, and \add there was\add* no counsellor , that, when I asked of them, could answer a word.\f + \fr 41.28 \ft answer: Heb. return\f*
Behold, they \add are\add* all vanity ; their works \add are\add* nothing : their molten images \add are\add* wind and confusion.
